I love the general idea but I would love to see a way that it would work better where variety is concerned.  There is no way my family  would accept eating the same sort of thing, even in variations, every day for a week.  It's the whole problem of having to come up with three completely different meals per day, 7 days a week unless there are leftovers, that stresses me out so much!   I want to learn how to prep and make this work, but I am thinking it will take me way more than 3 hours of prepping and a lot more recipes, storage space, etc.  Especially since our kitchen is tiny and has almost no work surfaces and very little storage... hmmm

looks disgusting and unsafe! cooked chicken and shrimp should only be kept 3-4 days. especially when they're Â mixed in with other ingredients that release moisture. cabbage, lettuce, and tomatoes produce so much moisture once cut in that container, which evaporates on to the lid and create a moist environment for the bacteria that can contaminate the chicken and shrimp even faster. and who eat 5 SAME BORING MEALS 5 DAYS IN A ROW! you end up getting sick of it and bored and end up giving up meal prep and diet faster than you know... all in all a very irresponsible video and just silly
